DOC.HEAD: Congress Adopts Resolution of Concern Over Romania
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet Congress today passed a resolution expressing serious concern over the unrest in Romania, calling for a peaceful end to what has become a bloody popular challenge to President Nicolae Ceausescu. The resolution by the Congress of People's Deputies was adopted after President Mikhail S. Gorbachev announced that information received from Soviet diplomats in Romania indicated the situation had seriously worsened overnight. He did not elaborate. The resolution expressed hopes for a peaceful settlement of Romania's problems ``in the spirit of tolerance, humaneness and respect for human rights.''
